alert.note: Alert for Cascade County below 5000ft (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 7:15PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Cascade Counties through 800 PM MDT... At 715 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Great Falls, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Malmstrom Afb and Portage. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
